result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

2:27 PM (64-06)  Defendant Robert J Rohleder in court.  Attorney Jason Mitchel Daane in court for Robert J Rohleder.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. 
Arraignment held in open court.
Attorney Daane acknowledged receipt of the Information, waived reading and plead not guilty to all charges.
Speedy reserved.
Attorney Daane is requesting STC in August.

Judge needs to be assigned and STC set in August.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Jason Daane

3:24PM Defendant Robert J Rohleder appeared by video.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney J. Danne in court for Tony Kim for Robert J Rohleder. 
Attorney Daane states defendant is requesting to hire a private attorney.
Court questions defendant if he will be hiring a private attorney, if so, how long will it take to hire a private attorney? Defendant stated it will take him about 30 days.
No objection by the State.



Adj. 3:26PM

Defendant Robert J Rohleder appeared by video.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court.  Attorney Tony Kim in court for Robert J Rohleder. 
Court was scheduled for a Preliminary Hearing. Attorney Kim made a record that the defendant would like to hire private counsel. Attorney Kim states defendant would like to waive time limits.
Court has a colloquy with the defendant regarding waiving time limits. Court finds defendant understands his rights.

Preliminary Hearing will be rescheduled for defendant to hire private counsel.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Robert J Rohleder not in court, Attorney Tony Kim for Robert J Rohleder appeared in court. Defendant being held on $5,000 cash bond in Racine County. State to prepare WRIT. Rights given and hearing requested, within time period. Minutes filed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Robert J Rohleder not in court, Attorney Tony Kim appeared in court for Robert J Rohleder. Defendant in Racine County jail. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 15, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

BOND TO COVER 22CF100 & 22CF103

Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH VICTIM. NO CONTACT WITH WALMART IN LAKE GENEVA. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
